docs.lead_paragraph: French food giant Danone, maker of Activia yoghurt and Evian water, has decided it wants to pursue a takeover of U.S. infant formula maker Mead Johnson Nutrition Group, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

headline.main: Danone Decides on Mead Johnson as Takeover Target-Sources
headline.print_headline: Danone Decides on Mead Johnson as Takeover Target-Sources

docs.snippet: French food giant Danone, maker of Activia yoghurt and Evian water, has decided it wants to pursue a takeover of U.S. infant formula maker Mead Johnson Nutrition Group, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej, the world's longest-reigning monarch, is continuing his recovery in hospital following surgery to remove his gallbladder earlier this month, the palace said in a statement on Friday.

headline.main: Thai King Continues Recovery After Surgery, Palace Says
headline.print_headline: Thai King Continues Recovery After Surgery, Palace Says

docs.snippet: Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej, the world's longest-reigning monarch, is continuing his recovery in hospital following surgery to remove his gallbladder earlier this month, the palace said in a statement on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. stocks extended their rebound from this month's bruising selloff on Friday, giving the S&P 500 its best day in over a week, as worries about the U.S. earnings outlook eased, but the S&P 500 still posted its fourth straight week of declines.

headline.main: Wall St. Gains One Percent on Results but S&P Down for Fourth Week
headline.print_headline: Wall St. Gains One Percent on Results but S&P Down for Fourth Week

headline.main: Behind the Cover Story: Nicholas Confessore on the School Food Fight

docs.abstract: The author of this week’s cover story on the political battle over school lunches talks about lunch lobbyists, “competitive foods” and whether pizza is a fruit or vegetable.
docs.snippet: The author of this week’s cover story on the political battle over school lunches talks about lunch lobbyists, “competitive foods” and whether pizza is a fruit or vegetable.

docs.lead_paragraph: Quarterly sales at French food group Danone beat expectations on Wednesday thanks to a recovery for its baby foods products in Asia following a health scare last year.

headline.main: Baby Food Recovery Keeps Danone on Course for Targets
headline.print_headline: Baby Food Recovery Keeps Danone on Course for Targets

docs.snippet: Quarterly sales at French food group Danone beat expectations on Wednesday thanks to a recovery for its baby foods products in Asia following a health scare last year.
